alert.note: Alert for Mobile (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 2:24PM CDT until August 24 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Urban and Small Stream Flood Advisory for... Western Baldwin County in southwestern Alabama... Mobile County in southwestern Alabama... Southeastern George County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 530 PM CDT. * At 224 PM CDT, Heavy showers and thunderstorms continue to move slowly east across southeastern Mississippi, gradually moving into Mobile County over the next couple hours producing torrential rainfall. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. * Some locations that will experience flooding include... Midtown Mobile, Downtown Mobile, Prichard, Tillmans Corner, Saraland, Theodore, Chickasaw, Satsuma, Grand Bay, Citronelle, Lucedale, Bayou La Batre, Creola, Dauphin Island, Chunchula, Gulfcrest, Axis, Mount Vernon, Calvert and Semmes. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
